repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

msContents.summary: Text of the work attributed to Śaṅkara and Lakṣmīdharā commentary. Text and commentary in Sanskrit. This manuscript should logically have been attributed a shelfmark 'sanscrit' in the BnF collection.

support.p: Different types of papers: thiner for U1, f93-f95.

collation.desc: the front cover; verso bearing sticker Indien 500.
1 unfoliated/unpaginated front guard leaf; recto bearing Tam. 500 in black ink and Tamoul N° 500 in black pencil; verso blank.
2 unfoliated/unpaginated front guard leaves; blank recto verso.
95 ff; Tamil original pagination 1-129/unpaginated page/130-188 and parallel library Arabic library foliation 1-95.
2 unfoliated/unpaginated back guard leaves; blank recto verso.

supportDesc.condition: Relatively good state of preservation. The binding is partly unbound.

additions.desc: Stamp SOCIÉTÉ ASIATIQUE DON COLLECTION ARIEL (U1, f1r).
Stamp BIBLIOTHÈQUE IMPÉRIALE MSS. (U1, f1r and f95r) and DON N° (U1, f1r).
Corrections in later black ink. Crossed-out portions.

binding.p: Leather (brown) covers; title SAONDARYALAHARI VYAKHYANAM and decoration on the spine.

origin.origDate: Earlier than 1855, since part of the bequest by Edouard Ariel (as attested by stamp on U1, f1r) to the Société Asiatique, received in 1855. Written by Rāmasvāli Śāstrin in the year Parābhava of the Jovian cycle, that is, mosy probably 1846-1847.

provenance.p: Owned by Edouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Edouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received (gift) by the BnF from the Société Asiatique in 1866 (BnF, Registre des dons B, no. 1192).

listBibl.bibl: Saundaryalaharī 1958. The Saundaryalaharī or Flood of Beauty. Traditionally ascribed to Sankarācārya. Edited, translated and presented in photographs by W. Norman Brown. Harvard University Press: Cambridge (Harvard Oriental Series 43).

Rosny, Léon de (1868). “La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry.” In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.
